title.narrative: Youth trained on initiating and organizing on collective action
84 youth completing one, two or more components of the training programme 7 mentors were appointed

target.value: 84 youth completing one, two or more components of the training programme 7 mentors were appointed

actual.value: 71 out of 84 young people completed the full training programme composed of four main topics (84%), while 13 young people only attended two or three topics (16%).

target.value: 84 youth completing one, two or more components of the training programme 7 mentors were appointed

actual.value: 71 out of 84 young people completed the full training programme composed of four main topics (84%), while 13 young people only attended two or three topics (16%).

title.narrative: Youth trained in leading community-based humanitarian action
Enabling and learning environment with peer-to-peer support created in the youth centres

211 youth accessing the centres at least 3 times per month
621 of youth experiencing marginalisation enrolling in the structured training programme
Extent to which youth across demographics interact 100% of mentees that have contact with the mentor at least monthly

target.value: 211 youth accessing the centres at least 3 times per month 621 of youth experiencing marginalisation enrolling in the structured training programme Extent to which youth across demographics interact 100% of mentees that have contact with the mentor at least monthly

actual.value: 96% of the 829 participants visited the centre at least 3 times per month (211). 90% of them reported that they were very comfortable with their participation in activities involving people of different nationalities. Also, 60.6% of the participants got introduced to people from different nationalities by participating in activities and 100% of them agreed that the mentors had a positive role in supporting them.

target.value: 211 youth accessing the centres at least 3 times per month 621 of youth experiencing marginalisation enrolling in the structured training programme Extent to which youth across demographics interact 100% of mentees that have contact with the mentor at least monthly

actual.value: 96% of the 829 participants visited the centre at least 3 times per month (211). 90% of them reported that they were very comfortable with their participation in activities involving people of different nationalities. Also, 60.6% of the participants got introduced to people from different nationalities by participating in activities and 100% of them agreed that the mentors had a positive role in supporting them.

title.narrative: The youth centre spaces are established with youth participation including governance structures

Extent to which the centres have been established and run through collaborative participation
Governance structure guarantees participatory decision-making process is agreed and applied

actual.value: AAAR and partners upgraded of the two youth centres in close collaboration with young people, though procurement of equipment, dividing rooms according to the approved activities, development of work plan. The youth centers are run on a day-to-day basis to facilitate interactions, meetings, and activities for and with youth through a committee of young people meeting every month to facilitate these process.

AAAR and partners upgraded of the two youth centres in close collaboration with young people, though procurement of equipment, dividing rooms according to the approved activities, development of work plan. The youth centers are run on a day-to-day basis to facilitate interactions, meetings, and activities for and with youth through a committee of young people meeting every month to facilitate these process.

title.narrative: Social cohesion and community-based humanitarian action initiatives through youth collaborative participation completed

10 social cohesion (8) and humanitarian action initiatives (2) 80% of social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives that are assessed to be of good quality 5,315 community members reach with social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives

target.value: 10 social cohesion (8) and humanitarian action initiatives (2) 80% of social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives that are assessed to be of good quality 5,315 community members reach with social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives

actual.value:
All young people trained under outputs 2.1 and 2.2 participated in the design and implementation of the social cohesion and community-based humanitarian action initiatives. Eight social cohesion initiative have been led.
Two humanitarian interventions were led by young people that provided NFIs and food kits to a total of 1,063 households including 744 women headed households (70%).

target.value: 10 social cohesion (8) and humanitarian action initiatives (2) 80% of social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives that are assessed to be of good quality 5,315 community members reach with social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives

actual.value:
All young people trained under outputs 2.1 and 2.2 participated in the design and implementation of the social cohesion and community-based humanitarian action initiatives. Eight social cohesion initiative have been led.
Two humanitarian interventions were led by young people that provided NFIs and food kits to a total of 1,063 households including 744 women headed households (70%).

title.narrative: Outreach activities for and by youth completed

0 door-to-door visits carried out by youth (cancelled due to COVID19)
75% of youth reached considered to be experiencing marginalisation 829 unique youth visiting the centres

target.value:
0 door-to-door visits carried out by youth (cancelled due to COVID19)
75% of youth reached considered to be experiencing marginalisation 829 unique youth visiting the centres

actual.value: Due to COVID19, door-to-door visits were suspended. Outreach activities were redesigned to be online. Young people used social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Whatsapp, etc.) to promote the youth centres and its activities. In total, outreach activities for and conducted by young people resulting the participation of 829 youth (18-32 years old) in the centre activities from different communities and nationalities, against 600 planned initially due to the high needs of the communities targeted.

target.value:
0 door-to-door visits carried out by youth (cancelled due to COVID19)
75% of youth reached considered to be experiencing marginalisation 829 unique youth visiting the centres

actual.value: Due to COVID19, door-to-door visits were suspended. Outreach activities were redesigned to be online. Young people used social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Whatsapp, etc.) to promote the youth centres and its activities. In total, outreach activities for and conducted by young people resulting the participation of 829 youth (18-32 years old) in the centre activities from different communities and nationalities, against 600 planned initially due to the high needs of the communities targeted.

title.narrative: Targeted youth experience social cohesion with fellow youth centre attendees.

Indicator 1: 75% Youth who reports an increase in meaningful relationships
Indicator 2: 75% Youth who reports an increased sense of connectedness

target.value:
Indicator 1: 75% Youth who reports an increase in meaningful relationships
Indicator 2: 75% Youth who reports an increased sense of connectedness

actual.value: Outcome 1 – social cohesion: The opening of the two youth centres had high participation from youth (62% women, 60% from refugee community), and they reported positive feelings from engaging in the youth centres. Young people-built relations with the project facilitators and were willing to build relationship with new peers. In fact, 98% of youth reported to have been introduced to new people through the centres, and 75% reported continuing these relationships after the project.

title.narrative: Targeted youth have an increased sense of agency that enables them to take collective action.

Indicator 1: 60% of youth with increased knowledge as a result of the training programme Indicator 2: 100% of 84 youth carried out social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives Indicator 3: 90% of youth who reports an increased sense of agency

target.value: Indicator 1: 60% of youth with increased knowledge as a result of the training programme Indicator 2: 100% of 84 youth carried out social cohesion and humanitarian action initiatives Indicator 3: 90% of youth who reports an increased sense of agency
